meanings.definition: Appearing worthy of belief or acceptance; credible.
meanings.sent1: The scientist presented a plausive theory that everyone found believable.
meanings.sent2: Her explanation was so plausive that no one doubted its truth.
meanings.sent3: The cat's plausive attempt to blame the dog for the broken vase made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The plausive excuse for being late was that he got stuck in traffic, but no one believed him.
meanings.sent5: The plausive alibi provided by the witness helped solve the mystery.

meanings.sent1: The plausive smile on her face showed she was happy with the result.
meanings.sent2: His plausive comments about her performance made her feel appreciated.
meanings.sent3: The plausive nod from the teacher encouraged the student to keep up the good work.
meanings.sent4: The plausive applause filled the room after the amazing performance.
meanings.sent5: Her plausive words lifted his spirits and motivated him to do even better.
